newsitem.title: BRAZIL: Eletrobras to sell Furnas, Eletrosul first.
newsitem.headline: Eletrobras to sell Furnas, Eletrosul first.

text.p: Brazil's power utility holding Eletrobras said Furnas and Eletrosul will be the first of its four power-generating firms to be put on the auction block beginning late next year.
The other two, Eletronorte and Companhia Hidreletrica do Sao Francisco (Chesf), will be sold later, after they have expanded facilities, said an Eletrobras spokesman.

He said a bid specification to hire advisers to draw up a plan for the privatization of the four power generators should be published in January. By then, a project for the restructuring of the electrical sector will already be completed, the spokesman added.

The project, which has been prepared by the accounting and consulting firm Coopers & Lybrand, is expected to be ready by December and will set rules for pricing Eletrobras assets. These rules will also regulate the selloff of Eletrobras' 11 small hydroelectric and thermoelectric plants slated for privatization early next year.
Eletrobras plans to raise 3 billion reais from the sale of these small power plants.
